Introduction to Communication Design: B Practical Media Production Essentials

This module builds upon the basic Introduction to communications Design A from Semester 1 by further enabling students to understand and practice contemporary audio-visual media production and integrating the produced elements into the overall communication design. The curriculum is structured to provide an essential understanding of both theoretical and practical aspects of communication design required for professional practice in the field.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Apply critical thinking skills to analyse and evaluate design concepts and their effectiveness in different contexts

+  Effectively communicate ideas and messages using audio-visual design and production integrated with typography, imagery and visual rhetoric.

+  Utilise sketchbooks as a tool for design ideation and exploration, fostering creativity and experimentation in the design process.

+  Critically reflect on transitional learning through materials appropriate to creative practice.
